The Summit Learning Teacher Residency participated in the 18th Annual Hermanos Unidos National Conference at UCLA on March 2nd. The Hermanos Unidos Organization is the highest concentration of college educated Latino men seeking to advance themselves professionally and personally.

This year’s theme was “Action”. In the face of rising dropout rates, Hermanos Unidos de UCLA wanted to give their members the tools to stay in school and establish themselves as professionals.

Summit Learning Teacher Residency Manager of Recruitment, Kelly Smith hosted a workshop on “Pathways Into Education”. The conversations and participation was powerful, engaging and productive (including some laughs). Shout out to David Mora and his the team at the UCLA Career Center for hosting a successful event.

Last year, Summit's Tech Team donated recycled laptops to the Hidden Road Initiative (HRI). Here is what happened to them:

Most of the laptops were taken to Shvanidzor, a remote village on the border of Armenia and Iran for students 4-18 years old. The school previously had no laptops at all. HRI and the school ran their 2016 summer camp using these laptops. The students presented their first powerpoint presentations ever at the end of the camp. They have been using them all year!

A donated laptop was also given to a Syrian refugee living in Armenia to help with her online job search, as well as giving her a way to stay in touch with her family. Her laptop has opened many economic opportunities for her.

Finally, a few laptops were given to village students who are now attending college Yerevan, the nation's capital and need computers to complete their education.

Thank you, Hidden Road Initiative, for allowing us to touch the lives of many.
